description.en: The course first covers the primary sources and actors of the international law of the sea as well as its historical development. It then proceeds with a discussion on the maritime zones: internal waters, territorial sea, archipelagic waters, contiguous zone, exclusive economic zone, continental shelf, high seas and the deep seabed. In the course of this, particular emphasis will be set on the passage rights of foreign ships and aircraft, the legal regime of straits (emphasis on the Arctic and Baltic straits), maritime boundary delimitation, marine scientific research, marine environmental protection (emphasis on the Arctic Ocean and the Baltic Sea), law enforcement and maritime security, human rights at sea, and dispute settlement. Particular emphasis is on examining the relevant State practice and case law of the International Court of Justice and the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea.
description.et: Õppeaines käsitletakse esmalt peamisi õigusallikaid ja osapooli rahvusvahelises mereõiguses ning selle valdkonna ajaloolist arengut. Seejärel keskendutakse merevöönditele: sisevetele, territoriaalmerele, arhipelaagivetele, kontrollvööndile, majandusvööndile, mandrilavale, avamerele ja süvamerepõhjale. Selle käigus pööratakse erilist rõhku välisriikide laevade ja lennukite läbipääsuõigustele, väinadele (rõhuasetus Arktika ja Läänemere väinadel), merepiiride delimiteerimisele, teaduslikele mereuuringutele, merekeskkonna kaitsele (rõhuasetus Põhja-Jäämerel ja Läänemerel), merendusjulgeolekuõigusele, inimõiguste kaitsele merel ning vaidluste lahendamisele. Olulisel kohal on riikide praktika ja Rahvusvahelise Kohtu ning Rahvusvahelise Mereõiguse Kohtu kohtupraktika uurimine.

objectives.en: To provide a comprehensive understanding of the development, substance and implementation of the international law of the sea within the modern legal framework of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, as well as to develop the ability to solve practical legal issues in this field.
objectives.et: Pakkuda süvendatud teadmisi rahvusvahelise mereõiguse arengust, sisust ja rakendamisest  ÜRO mereõiguse konventsiooni õigusraamistikus ning kujundada oskust lahendada praktilisi mereõiguslikke probleeme.

notes.et: Teretulnud on tudengid ka väljaspoolt magistriprogrammi International Law and Human Rights, eeskätt mereõiguse vallas uurimis- või magistritöid kirjutavad üliõpilased.

description.et:
Grades
A	the answers to theoretical questions are remarkable; the examination of hypothetical cases is full, logical and creative; the analysis of legal problems is detailed and innovative; all relevant norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice are thoughtful and creative; the form is excellent; overall, the treatment of the subject is a remarkable achievement [91-100 points]
B	the answers to theoretical questions are very good with insignificant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is purposeful and creative; the analysis of legal problems is very good with insignificant deficiencies; necessary norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice support the conclusions; the form is very good; overall, the treatment of the subject is logical and smooth [81-90 points]
C	the answers to theoretical questions are good, but there are mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases addresses correctly the central issues; the analysis of legal problems is good with some deficiencies concerning specific issues; key norms and principles have been used; the form is good; overall, the coverage of the subject is logical, but there are weaknesses from the point of view of the whole [71-80 points]
D	the answers to theoretical questions are fair, but there are several mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is satisfactory, but focuses only on the central aspects; the analysis of legal problems is satisfactory with deficiencies in most aspects; only basic norms and principles have been used; the form is fair; overall, the treatment of the subject is plausible, but insecure [61-70 points]
E	the answers to theoretical questions are poor with significant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is weak and limited only to the very basic aspects; the analysis of legal problems is shallow with significant deficiencies is most aspects; only some rudimentary norms and principles have been used; overall, the coverage of the subject suffers of superficial treatment, poor knowledge of law and unsound presentation [51-60 points]
